intro: Scaevola lambertiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian iceplant, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blue or violet flowers. The plant has silver-green foliage with hairy surfaces, adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in sandy soils. Scaevola lambertiana is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardiness.
